intro: Senecio espiritosantensis, commonly known as the Espiritosantensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
